pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:0.5_0: The training rule on covering the head
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.13_0: if he teaches the person after getting them to uncover their head;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.14_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.17_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on married girls, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people with a covered head. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone with a covered head who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.5_0: the upper robe also covers the head is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.6_0: One should not give a teaching to anyone with a covered head who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.7_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone with a covered head who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
